channel.title: Width-Based Planning on Sukai Huang
channel.description: Recent content in Width-Based Planning on Sukai Huang

item.title: Dominik_drexler Expressing and Exploiting the Common Subgoal Structure of Classical Planning Domains Using Sketches 2021
item.description:
[TOC]

  1. Title: Expressing and Exploiting the Common Subgoal Structure of Classical Planning Domains Using Sketches
  2. Author: Dominik Drexler et. al.
  3. Publish Year: 2021
  4. Review Date: Dec 2021

Summary of paper

Algorithms like SIW often fail when the goal is not easily serialisable or when some of the subproblems have a high width. In this work, the author address these limitations by using a simple but powerful language for expressing finer problem decompositions called policy sketches.

item.title: Stefan O Toole Width Based Lookaheads With Learnt Base Policies and Heuristics Over the Atari 2600 Benchmark 2021 Paper Reivew
item.description:
[TOC]

  1. Title: Width-based Lookaheads with Learnt Base Policies and Heuristics Over the Atari-2600 Benchmark
  2. Author: Stefan O’Toole et. al.
  3. Publish Year: 2021
  4. Review Date: Tue 16 Nov 2021

Summary of paper

This needs to be only 1-3 sentences, but it demonstrates that you understand the paper and, moreover, can summarize it more concisely than the author in his abstract.

This paper proposed a new width-based planning and learning agent that can play Atari-2600 games (though it cannot play Montezuma’s Revenge). The author claimed that width-based planning exploration plus (greedy) optimal MDP policy exploitation is able to achieve better performance than Monte-Carlo Tree Search.
